attributes.action: extend the deadline for the Road Pricing petition by two months to allow everyone time to express their opinion.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Restricted operation of the E-Petitions website has made it difficult or impossible for many people to enter their signatures on the "vehicle tracking" petition, and some important pages appear to have been completely inaccessible for a large proportion of the time.
It is encouraging that so many people have been persistent enough to wait as much as 5 hours to sign, but if the bandwidth remains this restricted then signatures will be artificially limited to well below 2M by the 20th Feb deadline, effectively disenfranchising the remainder of the population.
In order for democracy to operate properly adequate time must be allowed to compensate for the bottleneck that has been created.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
